sec.label: C.7
sec.title: Noise declaration
sec.p: The noise declaration shall explicitly state that the noise emission values have been obtained according to this Annex B. Otherwise, the noise declaration shall indicate clearly what the deviations are.
The noise emission values to be declared are:

list-item.p: the A-weighted emission sound pressure level at the operator's position where this exceeds 70 dB. Where the level does not exceed 70 dB, the fact shall be indicated;
the peak C-weighted instantaneous sound pressure level value at the operator’s position, where this exceeds 63 Pa (130 dB in relation to 20 μPa);
the A-weighted sound power level emitted by the machine.

sec.p: The measurement uncertainty shall be dealt with in the following manner:

list-item.p: the declaration of the emission sound pressure level at the operator’s position shall have the format of a dual-number declaration, as defined in ISO 4871;

the declaration of the sound power level shall have the format of a single-number declaration, as defined in ISO 4871 on surface rigs, and the format of dual-number declaration, as defined in ISO 4871 on underground rigs.

sec.p: The declaration of noise emission values shall be done according to ISO 4871. Values of the standard deviation of reproducibility (σR), other than those considered in ISO 4871, can be selected by the manufacturer if supporting data is provided.

non-normative-note.label: NOTE
non-normative-note.p: The methodology is based on the use of the measured values and uncertainties. The latter are the uncertainty associated with the measurement procedure (which is determined by the grade of accuracy of the measurement method used) and the production uncertainty (variation of noise emission from one machine to another of the same type made by the same manufacturer).

sec.p: Additional noise emission values may be given in the noise declaration, but only in such a way that they cannot be confused with the declared values.

In the case of verification of declared values, measurements shall be carried out in accordance with this Annex B by using the same operating conditions of the machine as those used for the initial determination of the noise emission values.
The operation manual shall contain information on sound power level from rigs and the emission sound pressure level at the operator's positions as follows:

list-item.p: instructions relating to installation and assembly of measures for reducing noise;

a statement that the noise emission values were determined during a standard test cycle and are not necessarily representative for all conditions in accordance with the intended use. The operating conditions such as the soil or rock the machine is operated on or the operating environment such as sound reflective surfaces nearby can cause the sound levels to be higher than the declared values.
